biography.summary: Maria Cantwell is the United States Senator from Washington, serving since 2001. A Democrat, she focuses on technology and innovation, energy policy, trade, and climate issues, advocating for jobs, competitiveness, and consumer protections.

contact.office_address: 511 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Support federal investment in R&D and broadband access
Supports clean energy, climate action, and responsible resource development

bills_sponsored.title: COMPETES Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Legislation to strengthen U.S. competitiveness in science and technology.

timeline.event: Elected to the U.S. Senate representing Washington
Re-elected to the U.S. Senate, continuing tenure
Re-elected to the U.S. Senate, continuing tenure
